page.title: 12A DAY AT PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content:
"At{West Kirby Primary School}the whistle goes at 8.55 am. We go into class and do the register. After Assembly we read and do Maths, then we go out to play. After English it is lunchtime. On Mondays we do P.E. then read until afternoon play time. We finish our work and go home at 3.30. I prefer days when we play rounders and do story writing, and Fridays because you've got a whole free weekend ahead."
{"Hilbre Secondary School,}opened in 1966, is one the schools we may go to when we are 11. There are 860 boys and girls, from 11 to 18. They study a lot of different subjects. Staff organise holidays abroad and trips to Chester Zoo and Alton Towers. There are lots of clubs, school teams, an orchestra and choir."
